text.headline:
The Story of WordPress
2001 - 2018
text.text: WordPress was born out of a desire for an elegant, well-architectured personal publishing system built on PHP and MySQL and licensed under the GPL. It is the official successor of b2/cafelog. WordPress is modern software, but its roots and development go back to 2001.

text.headline: Movable Type launched
text.text: Movable Type is a blogging platform.

text.headline: b2
text.text: Michel released b2 at Corsica powered by PHP and MySQL.

text.headline: Matt Mullenweg's first post
text.text: Matt Mullenweg published his first blog post with Movable Type.

text.headline: Mike Little's first post
text.text: A few months later, Mike Little published his first post with b2

text.headline: b2's trouble
text.text: Michel lost his job and never went back to b2.

text.headline: Matt forked b2
text.text:
On April 1, 2003, Matt created a new branch of b2 on SourceForge.

Matt was not the only one who forked b2, there was many developers that forked b2 to create their own platform.

text.headline: The first WordCamp
text.text: It was WordPress San Francisco in 2006.

text.headline: WordPress 2.2
text.text: Introduced the Widgets.

text.headline: WordPress 2.5
text.text: It was released with a new administration UI design by Happy Cog, and introduced the dashboard widget system and the shortcode API.

text.headline: WordPress 2.7
text.text: Redesigned the administration UI to improve usability and make the admin tool more customizable. Version 2.7 also introduced automatic upgrading, built-in plugin installation, sticky posts, comment threading/paging/replies and a new API, bulk management, and inline documentation.

text.headline: WordPress 3.0
text.text: It introduced custom post types, made custom taxonomies simpler, added custom menu management, added new API's for custom headers and custom backgrounds, introduced a new default theme called Twenty Ten (which started the tradition of a new default theme for each year) and allowed the management of multiple sites (called MultiSite).

text.headline:
WordPress 3.8 - Parker
Introduced a modern new design
text.text: WordPress has gotten a facelift. 3.8 brings a fresh new look to the entire admin dashboard. Gone are overbearing gradients and dozens of shades of grey — bring on a bigger, bolder, more colorful design!
